Including the additional participants would increase the sample size, which would increase the power of the study and decrease the chance of a type II error (failing to reject a false null hypothesis). This would increase the probability of rejecting the null hypothesis when it is truly false. However, it is important to note that including more participants could also potentially introduce confounding variables that were not accounted for in the original analysis.
